line_1: Lovers' sighs, and tears, and anguish,
line_2: CUPID ne'er shall make me languish,

line_1: Let me hope (ah! how soon would it lessen my anguish),
line_2: When wearisome sickness has taught me to languish

line_1: All! hush! .... nor wake a parent's anguish!
line_2: Our cheerful hours without thee languish: '

line_1: And droop without knowing the source of my anguish;
line_2: 'Midst beauty and pleasure's gay triumphs, to languish
Sent in this foul clime to languish,

line_1: Who can speak a mother's anguish,
Mute, but to the voice of Anguish!
line_2: How do your tuneful Echo's languish,

line_1: Mute, but to the voice of anguish?
line_2: How do your tuneful echoes languish,

line_1: The tedious hours I told With Watchful anguish,
line_2: I hail thee now, no longer vainly languish,

line_1: Think not time can heal my anguish;
line_2: Leave me then alone to languish;
